DataElement.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor Percentage Intensity Stain Other Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify the other description or status of estrogen receptors, cytoplasmic hormone-activated receptors that act as nuclear transcription factors composed of an N-terminal transcription activation/modulation domain and a C-terminal steroid-binding domain, based on percentage and intensity of stained cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor Percentage Intensity Stain Other Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the other description or status of estrogen receptors, cytoplasmic hormone-activated receptors that act as nuclear transcription factors composed of an N-terminal transcription activation/modulation domain and a C-terminal steroid-binding domain, based on percentage and intensity of stained cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Widely expressed human Estrogen Receptors (NR3 Family) are ligand-activated nuclear hormone receptor transcription factors composed of an N-terminal transcription activation/modulation domain, a DNA-binding domain, and a C-terminal steroid-binding domain. Binding to DNA as a homo- or heterodimer, ESR interacts with NCOA3, NCOA5, and NCOA6 coactivators. Hormone-ESR complexes appear to recognize discrete upstream target ERE DNA sequences to regulate gene expression, cell proliferation, and differentiation. DNA-binding is lost in the absence of ligand. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Widely expressed human Estrogen Receptors (NR3 Family) are cytoplasmic hormone-activated receptors that act as nuclear transcription factors composed of an N-terminal transcription activation/modulation domain, a DNA-binding domain, and a C-terminal steroid-binding domain. Binding to DNA as a homo- or heterodimer, ESR interacts with NCOA3, NCOA5, and NCOA6 coactivators. Hormone-ESR complexes appear to recognize discrete upstream target ERE DNA sequences to regulate gene expression, cell proliferation, and differentiation. DNA-binding is lost in the absence of ligand. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:a dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:Not otherwise specified.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
a dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
